parse: Conjunction
str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: Answer, bid, bring word, command. A primary verb; to speak or say.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative Masculine 3rd Person Plural
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.

parse: Demonstrative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: This; he, she, it.

parse: Noun - Accusative Neuter Singular
str2: Neuter diminutive of pais; a childling, i.e., an infant, or a half-grown boy or girl; figuratively, an immature Christian.

parse: Preposition
str2: On, to, against, on the basis of, at.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Noun - Dative Neuter Singular
str2: Name, character, fame, reputation. From a presumed derivative of the base of ginosko; a 'name'.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Conjunction
str2: And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Who, which, what, that.

parse: Verb - Aorist Subjunctive Middle - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To take, receive, accept, welcome. Middle voice of a primary verb; to receive.

parse: Article - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Aorist Participle Active - Accusative Masculine Singular
str2: From apo and stello; set apart, i.e. to send out literally or figuratively.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Accusative 1st Person Singular
str2: I, the first-person pronoun. A primary pronoun of the first person I.

parse: Conjunction
str2: For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

parse: Article - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To begin, am, exist, be in possession. From hupo and archomai; to begin under, i.e. Come into existence; expletively, to exist (verb).

parse: Adjective - Nominative Masculine Singular - Comparative
str2: Little, small. Including the comparative mikroteros apparently a primary word; small (figuratively) dignity).

parse: Preposition
str2: In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.

parse: Adjective - Dative Masculine Plural
str2: All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Dative 2nd Person Plural
str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.

parse: Demonstrative Pronoun - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: This; he, she, it.

parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.

parse: Adjective - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: Large, great, in the widest sense.
